metadata.Title: CVE-2014-2904 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
wolfssl before 3.2.0 has a server certificate that is not properly authorized for server authentication.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2904` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwolfssl15 - 3.13.0+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wolfssl package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.13.0+dfsg-1').
